artifact.content: A user can make a phone call
If user can set up his phone to forward incoming calls to another phone
If a user receives a call while on the phone, he is notified by beeps and can switch between calls
An incoming phone call displays the callers name and number
A voicemail system that is protected by a password
User can specify the users that can call their phone
Each user account has a unique user name
Create a new account to use a certain telephone
Disables the user by suspending the account, so a history of the user can be kept.
Update a user�s account
Place a user�s account on hold, so he/she can�t use any telephone services

An invoice must list the following information for every incoming and outgoing call in the department: -�� Caller and callee number -�� Call start times -�� Call duration -�� Billing plan -�� Invoice balance -�� Department billing plan - Any warnings like feature suspension or late payments
System generates log information for each call placed, like the call�s start time, callee number, and duration
A billing plan specifies a set of price rates of a call and the conditions that come with it. Call features are also specified in the plan
Administrator can change the price/options for a billing plan
Department managers must pay monthly invoices for the department�s phone services
After an invoice is generated, it is sent to the corresponding department
System must be able to generate invoice statements for all departments
Invoices are generated automatically at least once a month
Error messages are sent to the administrator and user phone when an error is detected on the phone
New phones can be added into the system, and assigned an IP
Phones can be disabled and removed from the system
Phones can be reset
Admin can find which IP is assigned to which user
Admin can see the status of a phone, whether it is enabled or disabled.
The max number of calls that the system can handle
Make a phone usable to an employee
Disable phone from being used
Display how many concurrent calls are in progress
The system can run automated tests to check the status of phones
Admin can run manual tests against individual phones
The system can handle erroneous input (ie. Invalid IP, phone number, etc) and generate an appropriate error message
If a caller dials an invalid number then the system tells the caller to hang up and try again
The administrator can reset an employees password or change it
If all IP addresses have already been assigned to users, then no more user accounts can be created
If all possible phone numbers have already been assigned to users, then no more user accounts can be created
The user account creation process can verify that proper data is inputted in its appropriate fields (ie. Phone numbers are digits only, unique user name)
If a device is being added to the system, and it is already registered with a system, then the system assigns the device its old IP address
The system can send the following messages to a phone -�� No available IP -�� Disabled -�� Error
If there are no available IP addresses to be mapped to a phone, then the system sends a message to the phone displaying �No available IP�
If the system is testing a phone, and the phone does not reply, then the system will stop waiting and conclude the phone has timed out after 1 second
This system can be upgraded to support 2000 employees in the future
This system can be run manual and automatic tests, display phone status, and support adding, removing and resetting phones in less than 10 minutes.
99.9% of all phone conversations will not be disconnected midway through, and the system will only be down for a total of 24 hours a year
VoIP phone must operate the same as a regular phone to an employee
Each user can protect their voicemail with a PIN, and only administrators will have access to the system
